question.body: Which extracellular matrix protein allows for blood vessels to return to their original shape after passive compression or stretching?

response.feedback: Correct. Elastin molecules are disorganized but recoil back after stretching.
Incorrect. Collagen is stiff and prevents rupture.

question.body: Which extracellular protein is found in higher amounts in the tunica externa?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Elastin is concentrated in the elastic laminae.
Correct. Collagen is located in the tunicia externa and provides stiffness.
